programme.title: Gadget Man
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade investigates whether he can make himself a brighter, better man with the aid of gadgetry. First, he tests his reactions against TV anchorman Eamonn Holmes, before taking on actor Richard E Grant in a series of concentration challenges that involve controlling a Scalextric model car and flying a drone simply with mind power. The presenter also realises that to prosper in a battle with memory champion Dominic OBrien he must resort to cheating

programme.title: Gadget Man
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade showcases gadgets that highlight the benefits of staying home. Comedian Seann Walsh joins him to check out designs that deliver the health benefits of the great outdoors without the dirt and danger leaving the house can include. Richard then enjoys the company of mechanised pets before inviting comedian David Mitchell round to try out the latest gaming technologies. Lastly, he demonstrates live holographic broadcast technology that allows the host to party without the need for guests to attend, proving that leaving the home could be a thing of the past

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike and Frank are in for a frightening time as they set to work unmasking a range of creepy collections

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz return a naval artifact missing for half a century to its rightful home in Washington, DC

programme.title: Guy Martin: Proper Jobs
programme.desc: The presenter gets to grips with nature as a wildlife warden on the remote Calf of Man island while trying his hand at birdwatching, rat catching, and cleaning up a beach for seals

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May attempt to improve the ambulance, with the presenters all going their own separate ways to enhance one area they think could do with an overhaul. James focuses on passenger comfort, Richard tries to shorten response times by getting other drivers out of the way more effectively, an issue Jeremy tackles with the invention of what he calls the sports ambulance. Their three very different creations are then put to the test with a series of severe and often messy challenges. Plus, Formula One driver Daniel Ricciardo is the Star in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson tests the BMW M4 at the track, before switching to the German manufacturers hybrid-powered i8 for a trip up the A1 to Whitby, North Yorkshire, where he decides which of the two he would rather take for the drive home. Richard Hammond pays tribute to the Land Rover by attempting to drive one straight up the side of a dam, and James May puts the Mercedes AMG GT through its paces. Taking to the test track in the Reasonably Priced Car are Will Smith and Margot Robbie

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Heavy D, Nat, John, Linda and the rest of the bidders are in Southampton trying to outbid each other. Sean Kelly hosts

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees bidders in Lewes battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages in Northumberland

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore what Britons ate during wartime and discover how some of the UKs favourite dishes have evolved from rationing. The duo also meet army cooks to find out what troops on the front line eat today, and prepare rabbit stew and carrot cake

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore Britains fondness for picnics, preparing an alfresco lunch at Beaufort Polo Club in the Cotswolds. They also discover how the habit of outdoor dining in summer evolved into its current form, celebrate snacks such as Cornish pasties and Scotch eggs, and bake a Dundee cake

programme.title: Guy Martin: Proper Jobs
programme.desc: The presenter gets to grips with nature as a wildlife warden on the remote Calf of Man island while trying his hand at birdwatching, rat catching, and cleaning up a beach for seals

programme.title: Turkey with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which the presenter explores the country that lies at the crossroads between Europe and Asia, and discovers the dramatic changes it is undergoing. The first leg of his journey begins in Istanbul, from which he travels along the Aegean coast to the hostile border with Syria. He meets refugees trying to start a new life and a billionaire taking advantage of a property boom. He moves on into the Taurus Mountains and the Black Sea Coast, and visits a community trying to keep an ancient language alive

programme.title: Special Ops: To Catch a Criminal
programme.desc: When a woman reports being held against her will, Thames Valley Police suspect modern-day slavery and are shocked by the identity of the main suspect

programme.title: Mortimer and Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul and Bob head to a lake deep in the Surrey Hills, an area of outstanding natural beauty. As they approach the gates to the lake, they set their eyes and their hearts on catching big carp from the yet undisturbed and tranquil waters. Plus, Dr Anand Patel, an expert in mens health, joins Bob for a chat about weight

programme.title: Mortimer and Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul and Bob venture to the west of Ireland to fish the mighty Lough Corrib, regarded as one of the best places in the country to try trout fishing. They head out on boats and try out a new technique called dapping, with local guide Richie Johnston providing much-needed assistance, and also helping them in their quest to find out what exactly the craic is, where to find it and how to experience it

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got 2021 News for You
programme.desc: Extended edition of the New Years Eve special in which team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop are joined by a variety of guest hosts and panellists from the worlds of comedy, journalism and current affairs for a compilation looking back at the big news of 2021

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the quiz, serving up a selection of questions on the subject of restaurants. Trying to come up with the answers are Alan Davies, Phill Jupitus, Sara Pascoe and Mark Watson

programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis run through the main talking points of the last seven days with the support of guests Ed Byrne, Rhys James, Athena Kugblenu, Laura Lexx and Alasdair Beckett-King

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis pan through the last week and extract nuggets of comedy gold, with guests Maisie Adam, Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Glenn Moore and Evelyn Mok

programme.desc: Angela Barnes plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at Londons Hammersmith Apollo, warming up the audience and then introducing routines by fellow comedians Sarah Keyworth and Tim Renkow

programme.sub-title: When Did You Last See Your Father?
programme.desc: Bills mother reveals disturbing news about her late father, with the shocking confession that he wasnt actually cremated, but was in fact cryogenically frozen. The company that stored him has gone into liquidation - so now she has to take the freezer home

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Santini uses a paintballing event as an opportunity to antagonise Fox. Police drama, starring Michael Higgs and Caroline Catz

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Ripples spread throughout the station when Fox makes an official complaint against Santini. Police drama, starring Michael Higgs and Caroline Catz

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: PC Stamp is involved in a serious accident in which he kills a pedestrian while reversing an area car down a one-way street. The incident causes a rift between his fellow coppers - who all have opinions on who was to blame - and jeopardises Stamps future at Sun Hill. Graham Cole stars as the beleaguered copper

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Stamp has an emotional time, first attending a funeral and then upsetting a bride on her wedding day

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Ashtons nerves start to get the better of him as he prepares to take the stand as Stamps key defence witness, and Quinnan is called by the prosecution. Samantha Bond, better known as Miss Moneypenny in the James Bond films, guest stars

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Julienne receives an SOS from Holloway Prison, whose usual maternity workers have been struck down by illness, and when she and Trixie step in to help, the nun puts her reputation on the line to prevent a heavily pregnant convict having her unborn baby taken away by social services. Shelagh faces heartache when a routine pregnancy check reveals something far more serious, Alec has a confession for Jenny, and Fred takes the gang to the theatre to celebrate Chummys birthday - only for the trip to end in disaster. Lacey Turner, best known as EastEnders Stacey Branning, guest stars

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny has an eventful few days, starting with a patient who as well as having herself to worry about, is also struggling to cope with her mother, an agoraphobic who hasnt been outside for at least 12 years. On top of that, Alec asks the midwife to accompany him to Brighton for the weekend, leaving her wondering if his intentions are strictly honourable. However, things soon take a tragic turn. Meanwhile, Shelagh joins the local choir to take her mind off her problems. Jessica Raine, Leo Staar and Laura Main star

programme.title: Catherine Cooksons The Tide of Life
programme.desc: Gillian Kearney stars in the feature-length period drama following the fortunes of housekeeper Emily Kennedy and her relationships with three very different men. At first she is content working for the McGilby family while her father is away at sea, but finds her life thrown into turmoil by the death of one of her employers. With John Bowler and Ray Stevenson

programme.title: Last Tango in Halifax
programme.desc: Celia and Alan hit a stumbling block when the vicar refuses to marry them in church, so they go in search of venues for a civil ceremony - only to find themselves trapped inside a creepy medieval mansion. Gillian encourages John to stick up for himself, so he returns to Harrogate and tells Caroline he is moving back in - whether she likes it or not - sparking another spectacular argument. Raff moves out of the farm after Gillian discovers she is the reason he attacked Paul. Sally Wainwrights light-hearted drama, starring Derek Jacobi, Anne Reid, Sarah Lancashire and Nicola Walker

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: Peggy is delighted when Radio Catherine, her favourite pirate radio station, begins transmitting from Great Slaughter, one step ahead of the GPO engineer determined to bring them to justice. When their top DJ is murdered on-air, Sister Boniface is called in to investigate. Lorna Watson stars

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: An ageing confectionery company owner is found dead in his London hotel suite, and while Nikki tries to convince the sceptical DS Gold he was murdered, several businessmen begin to circle as it turns out the dead man was losing a desperate fight to prevent the sale of his company to investors. Feature-length episode of the crime drama, starring Emilia Fox, William Gaminara and David Caves, with guest appearances by Tim Pigott-Smith, Sharon Small and Priyanga Burford

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Sandra takes drastic measures to prevent Jack exacting revenge on the hit-and-run driver who killed his wife. With the teams future under threat, she tries desperately to keep the truth about the incident from shady new recruit DS Karen Hardwick, while working on a 10-year-old murder case to restore the squads reputation. Amanda Redman and Lynda Bellingham star

programme.desc: Stamp anxiously awaits his disciplinary hearing, knowing that with 11 previous accidents to his credit, hes probably in for a bumpy ride. programme.desc: Bella intends to build a spa, but her plans go over budget; the hotel has an anonymous inspection while Bella deals with the unexpected return of someone from her past

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: A retired jeweller offers Del-Boy the deal of a lifetime - then suddenly has a heart attack and gets taken to hospital with a briefcase containing 250 cut-price gold necklaces still chained to his wrist. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del enters one of Rodneys old paintings in a competition and is over the moon when he wins a holiday for three at a five-star hotel in Majorca. Soon after, the Trotter brothers and Cassandra arrive at Palma Airport - but Del-Boy reveals there is a slight snag. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Gwyneth Strong

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Dels beloved mum apparently makes contact during a seance at the Nags Head, inspiring him to visit the doctor to seek treatment for stomach cramps. Admitted to hospital for tests, he fears there is something seriously wrong with him - but a bacon sandwich and an alcoholic drink smuggled in by Rodney soon put the smile back on his face. Comedy, with David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney ties the knot with Cassandra, but Del has more on his mind than best man duties as the dreaded Driscoll brothers arrive at the Nags Head baying for his blood over some stolen mobile phones. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Gwyneth Strong

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del-Boy enters the import trade after striking a deal with Boycie to fetch a consignment of dodgy diamonds across from Holland, and ropes in Rodney and Uncle Albert to help. Their plans are jeopardised when old foe Chief Inspector Slater picks up the Trotters trail. Feature-length episode of the comedy, guest starring Jim Broadbent, with David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Miami Twice - Part One: The American Dream
programme.desc: Part one of two. The Trotters get a chance to escape Peckham for a holiday in the Florida sun - but it means Del leaving his newborn son behind. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star, with Buster Merryfield, Tessa Peake-Jones, Gwyneth Strong, Denis Lill and Roger Lloyd Pack

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Miami Twice - Part Two: Oh to Be in England
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Trotters arrive in Florida, and walk straight into disaster after their camper van is burgled and local Mafiosi take a shine to Del-Boy, who bears more than a passing resemblance to their boss. What Del does not know is that they are planning to have him killed as a way of faking the godfathers death to help him escape being sent to prison. Feature-length episode of the comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst, with a cameo appearance by Bee Gee Barry Gibb

programme.title: Dads Army

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Margo is horrified by the prospect of dressing in saucy clothes for her music societys production of Sweet Charity, and Tom discovers oil in his garden. Classic comedy, starring Richard Briers and Penelope Keith

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Margo has a burglar alarm installed, but Tom and Barbara claim they have nothing left worth stealing. Jerry is convinced he has failed to succeed his boss as head of the firm, and the Goods decide that despite all their problems, they are glad they became self-sufficient. Seventies comedy, starring Penelope Keith and Richard Briers

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom Good decides he has had enough of commuting - but his solution to the problem causes embarrassment among the well-to-do neighbours. First episode of the classic comedy, starring Richard Briers, Felicity Kendal, Paul Eddington and Penelope Keith

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom and Barbara introduce livestock into Surbiton - an idea that does not go down too well with the neighbours. Comedy, starring Richard Briers and Felicity Kendal

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: Gary realises it is high time he got rid of his moth-eaten, flea-ridden, beer-soaked sofa of 25 years - leading to a trip down memory lane reliving his youth, his first day at work and his meeting with Dorothy. Tony makes an unwise purchase when he buys a snake from a man in the pub

programme.title: Bottom: Hooligans Island Live 1997
programme.desc: Manic flatmates Eddie and Richie are marooned on a desert island - with only a nuclear bomb for company

programme.title: Toast of London
programme.desc: When Jane promises Steven a major part in a big-budget film to be shot in Britain, hes hugely excited. But when his famous American co-star has an accident on set, Toast finds his own role, playing a villainous rival, has terrifying consequences. Meanwhile, the actors ex-wife Ellen has become engaged to Stirling Porrich, a wealthy Devon crisp manufacturer, and hes determined to stop the wedding at all costs. Guest starring Matthew Holness and Amanda Donohoe

programme.title: Toast of London
programme.desc: Steven is reunited with an old flame he hasnt seen since they starred together in an American soap opera back in the 1980s. Now married to Josh Homme of the rock band Queens of the Stone Age, is Lorna still in love with Toast, or simply using him to make her husband jealous? The tormented actor seeks refuge in the home of his old friend Francis Bacon, who everyone seems to think is dead. Guest starring Morgana Robinson and Steve Pemberton

programme.title: Ghosts
programme.desc: Alison and Mike receive some exciting news about their guesthouse business, but the fallout soon sees tensions running high between the pair. Pat and Thomas learn about the challenges of veganism, Kitty attempts to adopt a new way of communicating that sparks confusion between her and Alison. Lady Button is delighted by a new arrival that allows her to tap into a past passion. Robin however is less charmed by the new addition. Julian is confronted by a hard truth, but is determined to prove everyone wrong. Alison and Mike reach boiling point as Robin comes face to face with his biggest fear

programme.title: My Hero
programme.desc: George decides to throw a surprise 30th-birthday party for Janet, but faces a tough problem _ he doesnt know how to go about it, or even what one is. Ardal OHanlon and Emily Joyce star

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth feels harassed by a combination of working at a charity shop, trying to impress Councillor Nugent and worrying about Roses love life. To cap it all, Daisy informs her that a strange woman in Daddys bedroom claims to be his fiancee. Starring Patricia Routledge

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: The Goods begin to reap their just rewards for the hard work they have put into the garden, although Barbara is too tired and bored to appreciate the benefits. Comedy, starring Richard Briers and Felicity Kendal

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: With the garden under control and the barter system starting to pay off, Tom plans to diversify into pig farming - but underestimates the ferocity of Margos opposition. Comedy, starring Richard Briers, Felicity Kendal and Penelope Keith

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour invents a car safety device and as soon as he hears Nora Batty is to attend its demonstration, Compo volunteers to be the dummy that tests it. Comedy, starring Michael Aldridge and Bill Owen

programme.desc: Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson star in a stage show based on the comedy series, in which toilet humour is rife as the duo find themselves stranded on a Pacific island

programme.title: The Power of Parker
programme.desc: Comedy about a self-made man struggling to keep his head above water as the 1980s turn into the 1990s. Martin Parker has the ambition of Alan Sugar and the swagger of Robert Kilroy Silk. With a chain of electrical stores bearing his name, he seems to have it all. However the truth is he swimming in debt, his complicated private life is catching up with him and hes starting to lose his power. Written by and starring Sian Gibson, with Conleth Hill, Rosie Cavaliero, George Costigan, Sheila Reid and Jason Barnett

programme.title: The Power of Parker
programme.desc: The morning after the night before has not started well. Diane is worried that she did not impress the school governors, Kath is revealing more than she should to the women in the old peoples home and Martin is desperately trying to get his hands on a chunk of cash

programme.title: Toast of London
programme.desc: Steven is reunited with an old flame he hasnt seen since they starred together in an American soap opera back in the 1980s. Now married to Josh Homme of the rock band Queens of the Stone Age, is Lorna still in love with Toast, or simply using him to make her husband jealous? The tormented actor seeks refuge in the home of his old friend Francis Bacon, who everyone seems to think is dead. Guest starring Morgana Robinson and Steve Pemberton

programme.title: Toast of London
programme.desc: Live on chat show Lorraine, Steven tells a tale that could topple the US government and destroy the entire world, while Jane tries to evade the men in black. Plus, Toast is overcome with a debilitating bout of stage fright when he discovers an outdoor performance of The Scottish Play, directed by acclaimed theatrical director Peggy Plywood, will be broadcast live on ITV. Although Ed and Mrs P are on hand to help, it may take someone with more gusto to shake him out of it. Starring Matt Berry, Doon Mackichan and Robert Bathurst

programme.title: The Power of Parker
programme.desc: Comedy about a self-made man struggling to keep his head above water as the 1980s turn into the 1990s. Martin Parker has the ambition of Alan Sugar and the swagger of Robert Kilroy Silk. With a chain of electrical stores bearing his name, he seems to have it all. programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on two women hoping to have natural births. Staff induce an 18-year-old expectant mother who is nine days overdue, but become concerned about the struggle she faces with the delivery of her large baby. Meanwhile, a 35-year-old overweight woman at risk of complications due to her size is taken to theatre, as her husband waits anxiously for news

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A couple who are expecting their fifth son disagree over whether they should have more offspring in the future, and a father-to-be who was adopted reveals that, despite his financial restraints, he cannot imagine being parted from his child. Plus, a woman prepares to give birth while coming to terms with the recent loss of her father

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A woman carrying triplets is booked for an emergency Caesarean two months before her due date, but staff have just 30 minutes to carry out the delivery when one of the babies shows signs of distress. Meanwhile, a couple about to become parents for the first time are told their childs heartbeat is dipping, and immediate action must be taken

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: In a One Born Every Minute special, cameras follow four couples through their multiple pregnancies and births. Ana and Paul are thrilled at the prospect of becoming first-time parents to triplets, but receive worrying news at a routine scan, while Beth has to have emergency laser surgery in her womb after her babies are diagnosed with twin-to-twin transfusion syndrome. Carolyne and Gordon, already parents to four children, are shocked to discover they can expect three more, while Sophie and Carlos try to cope with the premature arrival of their two daughters

programme.title: One Born: What Happened Next?
programme.desc: Three couples who have featured on the programme share their experiences of parenthood 12 months after they originally took part. A woman explains why it will not be easy for her partner to cope with looking after their child when she returns to work, and another couple voice their concerns about the effect that starting a family has had on their health. Meanwhile, Lucy seeks her husbands approval as she decides to resume her career as an opera singer

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick offers cutting-edge treatment for Luca, a long-suffering four-year-old springer spaniel with a painful elbow disease. He designs and creates a special screw for Lucas leg with a system for injecting a bone-growth gel around it, and after an eight-year-old Newfoundland collapses, its owners face an agonising wait for the MRI scans to reveal if anything can be done for the gentle giant

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Rescue Labrador Tom needs work with a serious wound on one of his front paws, and four-year-old French bulldog called Otis has suffered an accident while being chased by another dog. Professor Noel Fitzpatrick diagnoses a spinal problem high up in Otiss neck that requires surgery. Meanwhile, Bailey, a 10-year-old cocker spaniel, has quite a lot of pain in one of his hind limbs, but his owner wants to avoid surgery, and Noel needs to perform specialist imaging before he can offer any solutions

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.sub-title: Terri, Esme and the Chi Family
programme.desc: Pete meets Lurcher Terri, whos terrified of the world and must learn to trust again, and helps settle a family of chihuahuas given up by their heartbroken owner

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Adam and Jenine try to help a woman whos fallen from a first-floor window, while Laura and Natalie deal with a former paramedic who appears to have had a stroke

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Joel and Sam treat a woman whos in excruciating pain after tripping and injuring her leg, while Adam and Annie blue light to the scene of a car crash

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: Twenty-one-year-old Ben needs his gall bladder removing as a result of losing 11 stone, while AJ is having an operation to free the painful compressed nerves in her toes

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: Connie needs a polyp taking from her womb, Carl is undergoing keyhole surgery to remove torn cartilage from his knee and Brad is having a varicose vein stripped from his leg

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Sooze found the birth of her first baby easy and confidently arrives at Southmead with her husband Joe, but the contractions quickly get the better of her. Teri and Merv, who are about to have their fourth child, talk about the cravings Teri has experienced this time round, while Becki and Ian nervously await their new arrival, having finally committed to each other following an on-off romance

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: Michelle Ogundehin splits the contestants into three teams, each of which is given an open-plan office space to transform for a technology client, a sustainable beauty brand and a media team. The brief is to create a work space, a break-out space and a meeting space within the office, and Michelle will be looking for both displays of signature style and work that suits the needs of the client

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Many hands make light work as Amanda Holden and Alan Carr invite local friends Fabrizio, Maria Pia and Carlos over for a plastering party, but things soon get out of hand as a spillage nearly ruins their newly laid terrazzo floor. On a shopping trek in the coastal city of Trapani, Amanda seeks modern soft furnishings for the living room, while Alan hunts for antique knick-knacks in the old town. Both reunite to style the newly designed space and reveal their labour of love, aka Casa Alamanda, to their Sicilian family

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Transgender Kids
programme.desc: Louis travels to San Francisco, where pioneering medical professionals are helping children who say they were born in the wrong body to transition from one sex to the other. At the Child and Adolescent Gender Centre at UCSF Hospital, he meets youngsters who have been diagnosed with gender dysphoria and who are undergoing medical interventions, from puberty blockers to hormone-replacement therapy and ultimately gender-reassignment surgery. Louis spends time with the clinics patients and their families as they negotiate their way along this life-changing and emotional journey

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from the chateaux of the Loire Valley to the heart of the Champagne region at Reims, beginning in the city of Orleans in north-central France. Here, he follows his Bradshaws guide to the magnificent stained-glass windows of the Cathedral of Sainte-Croix, which tell the story of the heroine of France, Joan of Arc. Later, Michael takes a spin around the track at Le Mans in a French-built car, before making his way to the capital city of Paris. East of Paris, Michael finishes this leg of his journey in style with a tour of the cellars at Domaine Pommery in Reims

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo ventures on a rail journey through Germany, guided by Bradshaws Continental Railway Guide published in 1936. Starting in the vibrant city of Berlin, Michael visits the Museum of Modern Art in Berlins Kreuzberg, where he sees how a leading artist of the era, George Grosz, warned of the rise of fascism in a haunting self-portrait. In the Schoneberg district of the capital, Michael researches the decadent night scene of the 1920s, and looks at how cabaret culture is being revived today. When he reaches Weimar, Michael investigates the beginnings of Bauhaus design and visits the movements first building, before travelling onto Stuttgart, where he takes a ride in a high-performance Porsche to the manufacturers Stuttgart headquarters

programme.title: Great Indian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On a journey from Lucknow in Uttar Pradesh to Kolkata in West Bengal, Michael Portillo charts a course through Indias history from the days of The East India Company to the dawn of independence. In Lucknow, he tastes the famous kebabs, stops off at Bodh Gaya, where he meditates on its Buddhist heritage, and In Kolkata, he glimpses colonial Calcutta in the grand Great Eastern Hotel

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: On board Amity, Jimmy Buchan lands a hefty catch of prawns and wrestles with fears for his own safety and for the lives of his crew. On the Fruitful Harvest, Sandy swaps places with his 18-year-old apprentice in a role-reversal, which turns out to be an eye-opening experience. Later, when the boats return home to Peterhead, they get a shock that nobody could have anticipated

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Highlights of the second series of the documentary following the work of the UKs North Sea fishermen and their families

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek rubs shoulders with pop music royalty when he picks up a Morgan sports car, while a Second World War ambulance arrives at Thornton le Dale

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The Mathewsons take in a 1982 Audi Quattro and a Sunbeam Alpine. Plus, Derek takes delivery of a beautiful green Renault van, previously used as a bread van in Paris

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The Restos team try their hardest not to go too far on an Opel Manta. And a Peugeot 205 GTI brings back happy B-road memories for a mechanic who owned one

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: British car enthusiasts Will and Gus splash out £550 on a garage owners Mercedes 190. Its previous owner has failed to fix it, but the duo are more confident

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: An insight into mammals ability to learn new tricks to aid hunting prey and evading predators. Slow-motion cameras reveal the star-nosed moles technique for detecting its next meal underwater, while an ibex runs up a steep cliff face to escape a fox. A killer whale off the coast of the Falklands sneaks into a pool used by elephant seal pups and snatches them, saving itself the trouble of searching for food in the open sea, and three cheetah brothers work together to hunt a zebra. Narrated by David Attenborough

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: David Attenborough turns his attention to marine invertebrates - bizarre and beautiful animals that thrive in the toughest parts of the ocean. Divers swim into a shoal of predatory Humboldt squid emerging from the depths to hunt in packs, and timelapse photography reveals starfish gathering under the Arctic ice to devour a seal carcass. A camera also follows a female octopus into a cave, where she hides to protect her eggs until she starves to death

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: The strategies adopted by plants that enable them to grow in every possible environment, even where there is no sunlight, water or nutrients. Featuring the dragons blood tree, which survives in the desert by converting moisture found in the mist and shading its own roots, the carnivorous Venus flytrap that has evolved into an extraordinary predator able to digest insects, and the cats claw creeper, which uses other plants as a ladder to reach sunlight. Narrated by David Attenborough

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: The focus turns to apes and monkeys, revealing their similarities to humans. Large armies of hamadryas baboons battle on the plains of Ethiopia to steal females and settle old scores, while Japanese macaques beat the cold by lounging in thermal springs. An orang-utan baby fails in its struggle to make an umbrella out of leaves, and capuchins try to smash nuts with a large rock. Narrated by David Attenborough

programme.title: Turkey with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: In the second half of the journey, Simon travels along the Black Sea Coast to the capital of Ankara and the Northern Highlands, witnessing first hand the aftermath of fighting in Kurdish areas and meeting a conservationist attempting to preserve the regions brown bears. He then returns to Istanbul, where he takes part in a popular TV series set in the palace of the Ottoman Sultans

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: British car enthusiasts Will and Gus splash out £550 on a garage owners Mercedes 190. Its previous owner has failed to fix it, but the duo are more confident

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The Restos team try their hardest not to go too far on an Opel Manta. And a Peugeot 205 GTI brings back happy B-road memories for a mechanic who owned one

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek rubs shoulders with pop music royalty when he picks up a Morgan sports car, while a Second World War ambulance arrives at Thornton le Dale

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team fly the flag for King and country with one of their most luxurious purchases to date - a 1981 Rolls-Royce Silver Spirit

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics

Arrangements are made to transfer some of the hospitals critically ill patients to a sister site at Charring Cross, giving the AandE team more scope to help the victims, including teenagers Yann and Victor; French students in London on a school trip. A month later, as the passengers board, Jim meets a mysterious passenger who unsettles his wife, while in second class, Muriel Batley bitterly resents her husband Johns fawning to the Earl and reveals she knows a secret about his employer. programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: There are new housemates for someone, while Dylan feels trapped and Caleb pays off a problem

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Theo berates Todd for careless treatment of his new car, Debbie suspects Abi of dodgy dealings, and a conciliatory lunch between Tyrone, Fiz and Cassie turns into a tension-filled affair

programme.title: Coronation Street

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Ormerod faces a testing time when his father-in-law arrives demanding to know whether he was seeing Dr Weatherill while his late daughter was still alive. Following a heated exchange, it emerges that the disgruntled patriarch has hired a private detective to investigate the couple - but the situation only serves to bring them closer together, culminating in a marriage proposal. At the Royal, a painfully thin girl causes concern for Goodwin - whose green-eyed monster emerges when student nurse Samantha Beaumont agrees to a date with a younger man - and the hospital is evacuated after a suicide victims corpse is brought in emitting toxic fumes. Medical drama, starring Robert Daws, Amy Robbins, Paul Fox and Anna Madeley

programme.title: Agatha Christies Marple
programme.desc: Feature-length mystery, starring Geraldine McEwan as the genteel sleuth. A woman experiences an unsettling vision after moving into the home of her dreams - and it transpires she lived in the house as a child. Miss Marple investigates the history of the property and discovers it was connected with a baffling disappearance years before - which has never been solved. With Dawn French, Russ Abbot, Geraldine Chaplin, Phil Davis and Sarah Parish

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Rob lands himself in trouble when he spends the night with Helen, getting Geoff to cover his shift - and matters grow complicated after its revealed that the doctors estranged husband made the complaint. When a truck careers into a couples back garden following a routine MOT test Bernie struggles to remember if he changed the bald tyres, and a snooping journalist soon forces the muddled mechanic to flee

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: Period drama based on the novels by Winston Graham, originally adapted into a successful 1970s TV series. In late 18th-century Cornwall, Ross Poldark joins the army to avoid charges of smuggling, leaving behind his loved one Elizabeth - and when he returns three years later, having fought in the American War of Independence, he finds his father dead, his estate in ruins and his sweetheart engaged to another man. In need of help, he takes on a new kitchen maid after rescuing her from a beating - bringing him into conflict with hostile locals. Aidan Turner takes the title role, with Eleanor Tomlinson, Heida Reed, Phil Davis and Warren Clarke

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Eva returns to the street to take over the Rovers with her partner Ben, but his meddlesome mother Maggie isnt far behind. Meanwhile, Nick gets down on one knee for Toyah, Sarah suggests a solution to Todds financial worries, and Hope accuses Jake of being her tormentor

programme.desc: Kev delivers a chilling threat to Aaron if he does not leave him and Robert alone, while Ray orders Dylan to get a rucksack back from Dale View and Ruby argues with Caleb

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Whos Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Actress and former glamour model Linda Lusardi takes on the diners, who are hoping to end their run on a high point after suffering a turbulent week. Will it be a photo-finish for the ex-beauty queen or will her opponents grab the cash? Presented by Brian McFadden

programme.title: Paddington Station 24/7
programme.desc: Behind-the-scenes look at one of the UKs busiest transport hubs, chronicling the issues that face station staff, transport workers, emergency services, commuters and tourists

programme.title: Britains Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host as eight more acts who impressed the judges during the audition rounds put on the performance of their lives as they compete for a spot in the live final and edge closer to the life-changing cash prize of £250,000 and a spot on the bill of the Royal Variety Performance

programme.title: Harbour Cops
programme.desc: Documentary following the daily work of Dyfed-Powys Police officers over the busy summer months. Dyfed-Powys is the smallest police force in the UK, but has to patrol the largest police area, their jurisdiction taking in national parks and a lengthy run of the spectacular South Wales coastline. In this first episode, officers in the seaside town of Tenby on the western side of Carmarthen Bay have to deal with rowdy holidaymakers causing trouble and track down a pensioner who has been reported missing

programme.title: Live League of Ireland
programme.desc: Derry City v Shamrock Rovers (Kick-off 3.00pm). Coverage of the Mens Premier Division from The Ryan McBride Brandywell Stadium

programme.title: Britains Brightest Family
programme.desc: Having made it through to the quarter-finals, two families go head to head for a place in the semi-finals of the tournament, aiming to move a step closer to winning the coveted title of Britains Brightest Family and a holiday of a lifetime. Hosted by Anne Hegerty

programme.title: Storage Hoarders
programme.desc: Aggie MacKenzie heads to Surrey to help a woman with a busy lifestyle get to grips with her inherited hoard. She also encourages a father and son to search through the belongings in their large barn

programme.title: The Voice USA
programme.desc: The vocal competition continues to seek out exciting new singers based solely on their amazing voices, rather than their appearance

programme.title: Snowpiercer
programme.desc: Layton lays track for revolution while hiding out with help from his allies. An engineering emergency threatens every soul on Snowpiercer

programme.title: Snowpiercer
programme.desc: Melanie intensifies her search for Layton, who is weaponizing her secret. The Third Class face a reckoning when Layton presents them with a choice

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by reality star and businesswoman Kim Kardashian and award-winning actress Sarah Paulson, who are appearing together in the new TV legal drama Alls Fair. Breaking Bad star Bryan Cranston chats about taking to the West End stage in All My Sons, while actress and singer Rachel Zegler also appears, fresh from wowing audiences at the London Palladium in Evita. Plus, Little Simz performs Lion, from her album Lotus

programme.title: Flightplan
programme.desc: A widow boards a plane with her daughter and promptly falls asleep. When she wakes up, the girl has disappeared - and the mothers fear turns to outright panic when the aircraft crew insists she boarded the flight alone, suggesting the child is merely a figment of her distressed imagination. Thriller, starring Jodie Foster, Peter Sarsgaard, Sean Bean and Greta Scacchi

programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host the quiz in which Shaun, Julia, Anna, Ben and James race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try to win £5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.desc: New connections form as the boys settle into their summer of love, but as the first Kiss-Off approaches, some are worried about making head-or-heart decisions. Adam is still nervous to explore things with Ruben, but he knows he will need to grab the bull by the horns if hes going to step any closer to love

programme.title: A Rebel Education
programme.desc: This look at the joyous, complicated and messy world of secondary school education continues. Glamour queen Nicole is struggling to stay in school, Alannah has to make some big life decisions and rising athletic star Giselle gets ready for the race of her life
